title: Epstein affair: The downfall of Peter Mandelson, the evil genius of the British Labour Party
subhead: As the architect of New Labour, Mandelson was the driving force behind the British left's past triumphs. In a career spanning 40 years, the indestructible strategist had survived every scandal. Now, he faces public disgrace for his close relationship with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein that threatens to bring down Prime Minister Keir Starmer with him.

title: Macron's failed bet to achieve full employment by 2027
Canada 'mourns' after mass shooting, says PM Carney
French court rejects bid to reopen probe into Adama Traoré's death in custody
subhead: The Court of Cassation's decision definitively closes the case nearly a decade after the death of the 24-year-old following his arrest in the Paris suburb of Beaumont-sur-Oise, a fatality that triggered national outcry over police brutality and racism.

title: Iran's reformist camp hit by wave of arrests
subhead: Several prominent members of the Reformist Front were detained in early February after the publication of a statement condemning the crackdown on protests. This latest offensive against a now-marginalized political faction is the most significant since 2009.

title: The dance against the clock of skaters Guillaume Cizeron and Laurence Fournier Beaudry
subhead: The French duo is in the lead going into the free dance finale in Milan on Wednesday. The improbable accomplishment of a gold medal is within reach for a partnership that only formed one drama-filled year ago.

title: The Iranian protesters killed by regime gunfire on January 8
subhead: Sina Ashkbousi, Behrouz Mansouri, Mansoureh Heydari, Keyvan Moradi Mirani and Roubina Aminian were killed on the first day of protests against the Iranian regime. Their stories reflect both the diversity of the protest movement and the brutality of the crackdown.

How the Epstein scandal brought down Jack Lang
subhead: The emblematic minister from President François Mitterrand's era was forced to step down as president of the Arab World Institute in Paris. Former allies and rivals have begun to speak out about a man who used his influence and network to maintain a lavish lifestyle.

title: Emmanuel Macron: 'Now is the time for the EU to launch a joint borrowing capacity, through eurobonds'
subhead: Two days ahead of a meeting of European Union heads of state and government in Brussels, the French president calls on the 27 member states, in an interview with Le Monde and several other European newspapers, to make joint investments in protecting the environment, as well as in artificial intelligence and quantum technology, to avoid falling behind.

title: The international drug trafficker who operated right next to the Elysée Palace
subhead: Firat Cinko faces life imprisonment for allegedly orchestrating international cocaine trafficking between Venezuela, Martinique and France aboard a Smart car parked near the presidential palace in Paris.
byline: Abdelhak El Idrissi and  Guillaume Daudin

title: The urgent need for a European strategy on economic sovereignty
